docs.lead_paragraph: My clunker was a '64 Ford Galaxie, logging maybe eight miles to the gallon on level ground, the back seat burned to the coils by a knucklehead friend who left a cigarette to smolder. When it died, just short of 140,000 miles, everything went. Sold it for scrap and $50 - with the tow.
docs.abstract: Why are Republicans opposing Cash for Clunkers? Because it's working.
docs.snippet: Why are Republicans opposing Cash for Clunkers? Because it's working.

docs.lead_paragraph: A top Republican accused the Obama administration Wednesday of collecting electronic data and building an "enemies list" of people who oppose its efforts at overhauling the health-care system.

headline.main: Talk of 'Enemies List' in Health Care Debate

docs.abstract: As the administration pushes its health care agenda, it is accused of going overboard in collecting information.
docs.snippet: As the administration pushes its health care agenda, it is accused of going overboard in collecting information.

docs.lead_paragraph: It's hardly the stuff of sweet New York summer Saturdays by the rowboat lake, but David Ippolito, the barefoot troubadour known simply as "that guitar man from Central Park," has a new song going national, airing Wednesday night on left coast television.

headline.main: A Protest Song Gets a Television Showcase

docs.abstract: It's hardly the stuff of sweet New York summer Saturdays by the rowboat lake, but David Ippolito, the barefoot troubadour known simply as "that guitar man from Central Park," has a new song going national, a cri de coeur against the nation's interrogation policies growing out of the Iraq war.

docs.lead_paragraph: The on the Senate Finance Committee -- three Democrats and three Republicans - who have been working to fashion compromise legislation to overhaul the nation's health care system has been invited to visit the White House on Thursday morning to meet with President Obama.

headline.main: White House Invites Finance Senators to Health Care Chat

docs.abstract: The primary senators at the center of negotiations on health care have been invited to the White House before their recess at the end of this week.

docs.lead_paragraph: Update | 10:10 a.m. Goldman Sachs is getting asked a lot of questions these days.

headline.main: Goldman Faces Inquiries on Pay and Derivatives

docs.lead_paragraph: Hear that? It's the sound of servers in Switzerland sucking down information from social networking sites.

headline.main: Open-Xchange Tries To Liberate Your Contact List

docs.abstract: A German maker of open-source software has set up a site where you can combine your contact lists from various social networking services.

docs.lead_paragraph: The president urged Democratic senators to keep trying for a bipartisan deal, but left open the possibility that they might have to pass a bill without Republican support.

headline.main: Obama Pushes Democrats for Unity on Health Plan

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN

docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic senators went to the White House on Tuesday to join President Obama in celebrating his 48th birthday and to plot strategy to pass a comprehensive health bill that would offer affordable insurance to nearly all Americans.

headline.main: President Gives Senate Democrats a Pep Talk

docs.abstract: Senator Harry Reid, the majority leader, said the White House lunch gave him confidence that he and his colleagues could "take on the world."
docs.snippet: Senator Harry Reid, the majority leader, said the White House lunch gave him confidence that he and his colleagues could "take on the world."
